habitat_description:
Southwest:
In California, small numbers of nonbreeders occur regularly through the summer (Cogswell 1977, McCaskie et al. 1979, Garrett and Dunn 1981). On the coast, forages on rocky intertidal and sandy beach marine habitats, on the intertidal mudflats of estuarine habitats, and on wet meadow and pasture habitats adjacent to the immediate coast (quoted from Swarth et al. based on Zeiner et al. 1990).

Great Plains/Southeast/Northeast:
Winters mostly along tidal flats, preferring mud flats to sand flats. To a lesser degree, inhabits lagoons, marshes, swamps, estuaries, sandy beaches and rocky shores. Also, mangroves where birds foarge in surrounding mud, roosting in trees at high tide. Some terrestrial habitats include dunes, meadows, short grass fields. Forages along coast near mangroves or on tidal mudflats, sandy or rocky beaches or estuaries (Skeel and Mallory 1996).
